intro: Sorghum ecarinatum, commonly known as the chicken grass, is a wild species of sorghum native to Africa. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and small, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it produces small, pale yellow flowers. Sorghum ecarinatum is often used in traditional medicine and as a forage crop for livestock.
